intro: Airella provincialis, commonly known as the provincial airella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering stems are usually slender and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. The small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, typical of the Cyperaceae family.
